GENERAL INVITATION Purpose of the Request for Proposal The City of Chicago ("City") acting through its Police Department ("Department" or "C PD"), invites the submission of proposals from firms with expertise and experience in Canine Primary Care Veterinary Services and/or Canine Specialty Veterinary Services . The object ive of t his Request For Proposals (RFP) is to acquire primary care as well as specialty veterinary care services for all of the Department's canines as described in Exhibit 1 Scope of Services of this RFP . The Chicago Police Department currently has 74 working canines. The demands of the job on these canines often results in the need for various types of veterinarian care. The Chicago Police Department seeks a qualified Contractor with the capacity to provide the following Part A: Canine Primary Care Ve terinary Services and/or Part B: Canine Specialty Veterinary Services as follows : Service A - Advanced Dentistry Service B - Cardiology Service C - Dermatology Service D - Diagnostic Imaging Service E - Integrative Medicine / Rehabilitation Service F - Internal Medicine Service G - Neurology / Neurosurgery Service H - Oncology Service I - Opthalmology Service J - Surgery Respondents may submit separate proposals: one that includes a complete response and pricing addressing both Part A and Part B require ments as one integrated proposal ("Part A+B"); and one complete response and pricing addressing Part A only ("Part A") or Part B only ("Part B"). Part A+B proposals will take precedence over Part A or B. If a Part A+B proposal is deemed to be acceptable and is recommended for contract negotiation and award, Part A or B proposals will not be considered for contract negotiation and award. Part A or B proposals will only be considered for contract negotiation and award when all Part A+B proposals are deemed to be not acceptable and are thereby eliminated as viable candidates for contract negotiation and award RFP For Part A: Canine Primary Care Veterinary Services; And Part B: Canine Specialty Veterinary Services Specificatio n No. 483378 2 The City recognizes that (i) certain efficiencies and co st benefits should be realized by both the City and Contractor if both Parts A and B are mana ged and delivered by a cooperative/single service provider for Part A+B services; and yet (ii) Part A and Part B can both operate independently from each other and under separate agreements, if necessary, and be performed by different entities, therefore t he City reserves the right to award Part A to one entity and Part B to a different entity . Notwithstanding other evaluation criteria described in this RFP, proposals shall be evaluated based on the most technologically advanced and best practice canine veterinary care service provider available with preference given to Respondents that have experience handling law enforcement dogs , by itself or through a team of partners or subcontractors. Companies with demonstrated experience in this area, and with a n interest in making their services available to the City of Chicago, are invited to respond to this RFP. The work contemplated is professional in nature. It is understood that the Contractor acting as an individual, partnership, corporation or other leg al entity, is of professional status, licensed to perform in the State of Illinois and licensed for all applicable professional discipline(s) requiring licensing and will be governed by the professional ethics in its relationship to the City. It is also u nderstood that all reports, information, or data prepared or assembled by the Contractor under a contract awarded pursuant to this RFP are confidential in nature and will not be made available to any individual or organization, except the City, without the prior written approval from the City.
